author: Simon Difford
description: A whole raw egg contributes body to this filling, flavoursome, wintry, delicate cocktail. The retained CO2 fizz of the cider adds essential body and balancing acidity but demands the use of a specialised shaker.
name: General Harrison's Nogg
recipeIngredient: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°brix)

recipeInstructions.text: BEWARE, shaking with fizzy ingredients such as cider tends to be explosive
Hence use a dry (less fizzy cider), hold both ends of your shaker firmly and ideally use a specially designed 'fizz' shaker (such as Perlini which is designed to be carbonated)
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into glass (without ice)
Be sure to shake well to completely emulsify the egg
